speaker: Verso
line: You’ll get used to them, we’re going to see a lot more.

speaker: Lune
line: If we hurry, we can cross before nightfall.

speaker: Maelle
line: Wait. Could we bury Gustave?

speaker: Lune
line: I wish we could, but protocol is to keep moving. Gustave would understand…

speaker: Sciel
line: We can look for a suitable place. Along the way, yeah? We’ll find a nice spot.

speaker: Verso
line: Actually. There is a place. Past the quarry, out of the sight of the Paintress. A tranquil haven protected by magnificent trees. I think you’ll approve.

speaker: Lune
line: Lead the way.

speaker: Verso
line: Let me show you something.

speaker: Lune
line: Any other tricks we should know?

speaker: Verso
line: One thing at a time.

speaker: Sciel
line: These are all… Expeditions?

speaker: Verso
line: A single Nevron took out most of them.

speaker: Lune
line: Is it still around?

speaker: Verso
line: I’ve only seen him once, many years ago, so most likely not.

speaker: Sciel
line: Looks like we passed the danger zone.

speaker: Lune
line: And no sign of your special Nevron.

speaker: Verso
line: Guess we’re lucky.

speaker: Verso
line: Hey, you holding up? We’re almost there.

speaker: Maelle
line: Holding up? Everywhere we go, just death, death and more death. Everywhere we go, just death. I just- I don’t want to see that anymore.

speaker: Verso
line: Look, Maelle, it-

speaker: Maelle
line: I thought YOU would understand. You said you spent your immortality burying the people around you. Doesn’t any of this bother you? And you. Gustave’s dead. How can you keep going like nothing happened!

speaker: Sciel
line: We need to continue.

speaker: Maelle
line: Why do you-

speaker: Sciel
line: Maelle. You know what we must do. “When one falls…” Come on.

speaker: Sciel
line: Merde!

speaker: Lune
line: Are you hurt?

speaker: Maelle
line: I’m fine- (groan of pain) Thanks.

speaker: Verso
line: Ready?

speaker: Verso
line: Well, turns out this Nevron wasn’t that strong, but you did well. You learn fast.

speaker: Lune
line: All this. This is what we’re fighting for.

speaker: Maelle
line: Is this the place?

speaker: Verso
line: Yeah. We can bury your friend under this tree, if that’s okay with you.

speaker: Maelle
line: Couldn’t wait for me, could you? I wish we could-

speaker: Lune
line: Rest easy, Gustave.

speaker: Maelle
line: I’ll finish what you started. The Paintress. Renoir. They will pay.

speaker: Sciel
line: No more Dome, just open skies.

speaker: Maelle
line: I’ll save them, Gustave. Emma, your apprentices, everyone.

speaker: Lune
line: You can leave it to us.

speaker: Sciel
line: You were always there for me.

speaker: Maelle
line: I’ll save them.

speaker: Sciel
line: Say hi to Soph for me, yeah?

speaker: Maelle
line: We could never tell if you were my brother or my father. But to me, you were both. The best brother and father I’ve ever had.

speaker: Lune
line: “When one falls, we continue.”

speaker: Maelle
line: Thanks for being my family. See you… in the next life.

speaker: Verso
line: … for about two hours then there’s a big lake. We shouldn’t go there. At all. Like it’s- We should make a right and then it’s going to take a few hours, and then we make a stop, we get some rest and some food, and then from there, we head north to Monoco’s Station.

speaker: Lune
line: Why there?

speaker: Verso
line: To recruit my oldest friend. We’ll need the extra firepower, because our next goal will be to take down the Paintress’ heart.

speaker: Sciel
line: Her heart?

speaker: Verso
line: Yes. You can’t just stroll up to the Paintress. The Chroma there is far too dense, it erases anyone who gets close. But if we destroy her heart, the barrier will fall.

speaker: Lune
line: Ok. So where is this heart? What does it look like?

speaker: Verso
line: What does it look like? That, I don’t know. But I do know that it’s somewhere in the centre of Old Lumière.

speaker: Sciel
line: You found Old Lumière?

speaker: Verso
line: Yes.

speaker: Lune
line: So it’s true. Before the Fracture, our Lumière was part of a larger city on the continent.

speaker: Verso
line: I’ve travelled with many Expeditions. I was with the 58s when we found Old Lumière. But Renoir erased them, before we could get further. And I don’t know much more.

speaker: Lune
line: Alright then. Let’s go meet your friend at Monoco’s Station. And then we’ll take the Paintress’ heart.

speaker: Sciel
line: How far up the mountain is Monoco’s Station? Will we see snow?

speaker: Verso
line: Not too high but yeah, there’s usually snow.

speaker: Sciel
line: Ah, fantastic!

speaker: Verso
line: Oh, right, there’s no snow in Lumière.

speaker: Sciel
line: No, only in books and paintings; it’s almost as mythical as gestrals!

speaker: Verso
line: And just as fun. And sometimes just as deadly.

speaker: Sciel
line: Oh, really? My husband was obsessed with the idea of snow. I can’t wait to see some.

speaker: Verso
line: That you will.

speaker: Lune
line: Your older friend is a gestral?

speaker: Verso
line: Yes, we’ve been friends for as long as I can remember.

speaker: Lune
line: Gustave would have loved that.

speaker: Verso
line: Why? Because he liked Gestrals?

speaker: Lune
line: Because… he liked the idea of friendships that could last decades. We don’t get to enjoy such long friendships in Lumière.

speaker: Maelle
line: How come Monoco lives so far from the other gestrals?

speaker: Verso
line: Monoco’s a “Searcher.” They travel the land looking for Gestrals who went missing after the Fracture.

speaker: Maelle
line: The Lost Gestrals.

speaker: Verso
line: Yeah. That, and he pissed off Golgra.

speaker: Esquie
line: That was sad.

speaker: Verso
line: Yeah.

speaker: Esquie
line: You were sad.

speaker: Verso
line: Um, yeah.

speaker: Esquie
line: You were thinking of Julie?

speaker: Verso
line: Not just her, but yeah.

speaker: Esquie
line: Want a hug?

speaker: Verso
line: Yeah, I do.

speaker: narrator
line: Maelle finds a spot where she can write. She spends some time writing in Gustave’s journal, to honour his memory. She gathers her courage and writes about Gustave’s sacrifice. How he laid the trail. She hopes Gustave’s apprentices will read this journal someday.

speaker: Sciel
line: What’re you working on?

speaker: Lune
line: Contingency plans. If we fail, Expedition 32 will need every bit of information we have.

speaker: Sciel
line: Right, but how’re you gonna get it to them?

speaker: Lune
line: I asked the Gestrals for help.

speaker: Sciel
line: Smart.

speaker: Lune
line: What are the stars whispering to you?

speaker: Sciel
line: Actually, I’m the one whispering to them.

speaker: Lune
line: Oh?

speaker: Sciel
line: It’s something my dad and I used to do. When I was scared or anxious, or even when I was happy. He’d say… “share it with the stars… When it’s hard to talk about things… The stars’ll understand.”

speaker: Lune
line: I like that.

speaker: Sciel
line: I talked to the stars a lot, after he was gone.

speaker: Lune
line: I remember. The night we first met. At the Crooked Tower.

speaker: Sciel
line: Right. After the Gommage.

speaker: Lune
line: I was surprised to find you here. I thought I was the only one who knew about that room.

speaker: Sciel
line: I had to go away from the harbour. And those damn petals everywhere. So I climbed up.

speaker: Lune
line: It wasn’t logical, but part of me really believed my parents and their expedition had succeeded. That they’d stopped Her. Then the Paintress woke. And I knew they weren’t coming home.

speaker: Sciel
line: You know, it meant a lot to me, the comfort we shared that day. But you avoided me after. Why?

speaker: Lune
line: I- It wasn’t personal. I- I cut a lot of people out of my life.

speaker: Sciel
line: Ok. Not personal.

speaker: Lune
line: That day, I knew my parents had failed. They were counting on me to finish their work. I couldn’t afford distractions.

speaker: Sciel
line: Friends are not distractions.

speaker: Lune
line: I know that now.

speaker: Sciel
line: Well. We’re in the middle of nowhere with one year left to live. What better time to build friendships?

speaker: Lune
line: Mm, I could use some wine though.

speaker: Sciel
line: Making friends is thirsty work.

speaker: narrator
line: Maelle quietly approaches Lune… Waiting to apologise for her behaviour on their way to bury Gustave.

speaker: Maelle
line: Hey…

speaker: Lune
line: Hey…

speaker: Maelle
line: Um… I, um… I didn’t mean…

speaker: Lune
line: It’s fine.

speaker: Maelle
line: I just…

speaker: Lune
line: I miss him too.

speaker: Maelle
line: It’s… it’s hard.

speaker: Lune
line: … The pain we feel… everytime we lose someone… I’ve tried many ways of dealing with it. Running from it. Sitting with it. Compartmentalising it. But what I needed… was to use it. To use everything.

speaker: Maelle
line: What do you mean?

speaker: Lune
line: I- Mm.

speaker: Lune
line: (exhale) I feel… everything… And I let it burn inside me. When I’m tired, when I feel hopeless, when I want to just let it all go… I use the pain, I use the fear, the shame, the guilt, the anger, I use it all to keep going. To make sure. I. Continue.

speaker: Maelle
line: Lune…

speaker: Lune
line: I can almost feel them beside me. Everyone we’ve lost… walking with me. Especially when I use chroma. I feel their presence, their closeness. And they help me.

speaker: Maelle
line: You feel Gustave?

speaker: Lune
line: Yeah, I do.

speaker: Maelle
line: I’d like to feel him with me too…

speaker: Lune
line: You have an affinity for chroma too. Try it.

speaker: Maelle
line: How do you always know what to do…

speaker: Lune
line: I don’t. Want to know a secret? I have no idea what I’m doing. And I don’t think anyone else does either.

speaker: Maelle
line: Huh. Really?

speaker: Lune
line: Don’t tell anyone else I said that.

speaker: narrator
line: Maelle and Lune spend more time together, in a moment that was special for both of them.

speaker: Maelle
line: Thanks. It really was a beautiful place.

speaker: Verso
line: Glad you liked it. I’ve buried friends there too. You were right. About condolences. We offer them, because we don’t know what else to say. But there’s no comfort there.

speaker: Maelle
line: No.

speaker: Verso
line: All we can do is carry them with us.

speaker: Maelle
line: I guess. Sorry. It’s just- We’re…

speaker: Verso
line: Drowning in our own sadness? Hey. Why did you join the Expedition? I mean, with the Gommage- I understand the rest of the team’s decision, but you’re half their age.

speaker: Maelle
line: Out here seemed better than in there. At the time.

speaker: Verso
line: It’s natural, wanting to escape a life you don’t want.

speaker: Maelle
line: Escape. yeah. That’s what I wanted. But Gustave and the others… They really want to change things.

speaker: Verso
line: Changing your life also counts. Can’t always shoulder the world’s problems, you know? That’ll drain you fast.

speaker: Maelle
line: Gustave would probably say, if more of us cared, then it would lighten the load for everyone.

speaker: Verso
line: He sounds like a good guy.

speaker: Maelle
line: Wait. I kept Gustave’s. So you can have mine. You’ll need one if you want to be an official member of our merry crew.

speaker: Verso
line: I gotta say, I didn’t take you for an “official” kind of person.

speaker: Maelle
line: Welcome to the Disaster Expedition.

speaker: Verso
line: Thank you.

speaker: Lune
line: How far to Monoco’s Station?

speaker: Verso
line: With Esquie, should be quick. Monoco’s Station is to the north, not far from here.
